Experience Sales Development Campaign Manager, Marketing Liaison Google January 2015  – Present (7 months) Austin, Texas Area This new role was established to push higher opportunity and pipeline conversion rates from marketing-engaged prospects. By working together, we were able to harness both marketing’s advanced prospect targeting & demand management’s selling and conversion expertise.  
-Directly influenced $1.9M in pipeline (Q1 2015) 
-Acted as liaison between the marketing and outbound demand management teams 
-Created tracking method for all campaigns where demand management was involved with marketing to ensure proper lead time per campaign and track necessary campaign assets 
-Provided consultation on most effective outbound sales prospecting techniques 
-Developed cadence and repeatable techniques for following up with marketing leads through the demand management team 
-Scrubbed all marketing lists for actionable prospects 
-Developed all follow-up email communication templates 
-Executed campaigns, analyzed process issues and created tools & methods to correct where needed 
 Events Lead Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Austin, Texas Area As the owner of the Playtime budget for the Austin office, I am responsible for organizing at least 2 office-wide events a year. This budget is set up to provide non-MTV office locations with more social events to help promote Google culture and office morale. 
-Responsible for at least 2 Austin office events a year 
-Worked within a set budget and tracked all expenses 
-Coordinated with the internal events team to ensure events and expenses were approved Business Analyst, Operations Specialist - Google for Work Google August 2011  – Present (4 years) Austin, Texas Area As the Operations Specialist on the LCS Inside Sales team, I was responsible for the Salesforce (SFDC) operations activities & data analysis. I was the SFDC expert on the team for best practices & processes. 
-Provided SFDC reporting, dashboarding, campaign management, data uploads, etc. for LCS ISA team 
-Supplied managers with relevant daily, weekly, quarterly & yearly reporting and numbers for communication on team’s performance to higher levels 
-Assisted outside teams (incl. Geo, Vault, Cloud Platform, Search) in ad hoc report, dashboard, campaign, and other SFDC requests 
-Communicated changes & best practices from top down in SFDC process to ISA team and ensure proper SFDC practices 
-Served as liaison for ISA team processes/needs with outside teams  
-Trained new ISAs in SFDC usage and particulars related to our instance and our team's usage 
-Located SFDC process/system problems & worked with the data quality teams to address these issues 
-Managed access for all data sources for Enterprise (Data.com, DiscoverOrg, Avention & Hoovers) 
-Completed mass data uploads & amendments via Lexi Loader tool

Summary I'm a marketer at Google with 10 years of experience in sales and marketing. I help product and marketing teams across Google think about mobile growth and user retention. I work on apps like Search, Gmail, Youtube, Chrome, Maps, etc. 
 
Prior to this, I spent most of my years helping small businesses around the world get the most out of the web. I contributed to the launch of Google Places, Google+ Pages, and more recently Google My Business. I also spent a lot of my time thinking about onboarding, growing and retaining customers on AdWords, AdWords Express, Helpouts by Google and Google Shopping Express. 
 
I relocated over 3 years ago to California to work at Google headquarters in Mountain View. I studied, worked and lived in Europe, Latin America, and the US. I have a MSc degree in Engineering from Telecom Sud Paris and attended one MBA course semester at EGADE - Tec de Monterrey.
